intro: Ficus rubrinervis, commonly known as the red-veined fig, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible fig fruits. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil. Ficus rubrinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to indoor conditions.
